Class Physics

java.lang.Object
us.stomberg.solarsystemsim.physics.Physics
public class Physics extends Object
The Physics class manages all physical interactions between celestial bodies in the simulation. It handles gravitational forces, collisions, numerical integration of motion equations, and maintains the state of all bodies in the system.

This class is thread-safe with synchronization on the lock object when accessing shared state.

  • Field Details

    • lock

      public final Object lock

  • Constructor Details

    • Physics

      public Physics(Integrator integrator)
      Constructor for the Physics class. Populates the array of bodies based on the generation data and initializes the physics system.
      Parameters:
      integrator - The numerical integrator to use for updating body positions and velocities. Different integrators provide varying levels of accuracy and performance

  • Method Details

    • updateBodies

      public void updateBodies()
      Updates the state of all bodies in the simulation for the current time step.

      This method performs the following operations:

      1. Makes position predictions for all bodies using the integrator
      2. Detects potential collisions between bodies (if collision checking is enabled)
      3. Handles any collisions by adjusting positions, velocities, and possibly merging bodies
      4. Calculates gravitational forces between all bodies
      5. Finalizes the position and velocity updates using the numerical integrator
      6. Updates visualization data like body trails
      The physics updates are performed within the timeStep interval, which may be subdivided if collisions are detected, to ensure accurate collision handling at the precise moment of collision.

      This method is synchronized on the lock object to ensure thread safety.

    • getBodyArray

      public List<Body> getBodyArray()
      Returns the list of all celestial bodies in the simulation.

      Note: While this returns a direct reference to the internal body list, operations on the list should be synchronized using the lock object to maintain thread safety.

      Returns:
      The list of all bodies in the simulation

    • getInitBounds

      public double getInitBounds()
      Gets the initial boundaries for the simulation view. Equal to the furthest distance from the origin any one body starts at.
      Returns:
      The initial boundaries for the view

    • getKineticEnergy

      public double getKineticEnergy()
      Calculates and returns the current total kinetic energy of the system.

      This method sums the kinetic energy of all bodies in the simulation. The calculation is performed in a thread-safe manner by synchronizing on the lock object.

      Returns:
      The total kinetic energy of the system in the simulation's energy units

    • getInitialKineticEnergy

      public double getInitialKineticEnergy()
      Returns the total kinetic energy of the system at initialization.

      This value can be used as a reference to check energy conservation throughout the simulation.

      Returns:
      The initial kinetic energy value in the simulation's energy units
